comments:
Using one 3.3 M5 candidate I20070207-1800 but I verified it also happend with I20070206-0010.

I *always* have several windows opened in my workspaces. Since I updated with a new 3.3 M5 candidate, I always get an error dialog while, opening my workspaces:
Unable to read workbench state. Workbench UI will be reset!

Here's the stack trace I got in the console:
!ENTRY org.eclipse.ui.workbench 4 2 2007-02-08 16:16:49.464

!STACK 0

Sorry to have not reported this problem earlier, but since beginning of the week I used a fresh workspaces for tests which had only one window opened.

And the point is that problem does not occurred when you have only one window opened while saving it...

So, here simple steps to reproduce:
1) Open eclipse on a brand new workspace
2) Open Java Perspective
3) Open Preferences dialog, go on General > Perspectives page and click on
   'In a new window' of 'Open a new perspective' radio button
4) Open Debug perspective
5) Close your eclipse session
6) Restart it on this workspace
   => Error dialog:
      Unable to read workbench state. Workbench UI will be reset!
I don't think this problem is related to bug 168524 or bug 170877 as I have no editor opened in my workspace while exiting eclipse...
Sounds like a duplicate of bug 173445

Ah, found it.
PW


*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of bug 173442 ***
